snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo vetoed the legislation regarding an Upper East Side catering hall who lost its previous liquor license because of a law banning sales within 200 feet of a church.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo vetoes legislation designed to restore liquor license to Upper East Side caterer Rose Group Park Avenue; caterer lost license in 2013 because of state law banning liquor sales within 200 feet of a church.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo vetoed the legislation regarding an Upper East Side catering hall who lost its previous liquor license because of a law banning sales within 200 feet of a church.

headline.main: Cuomo Blocks Liquor License for Caterer in Upper East Side Church
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Blocks Liquor License for Caterer in East Side Church
